item.title: Socios

item.title: Fundadores
item.description: Better Bike Share Partnership Mini Grant, Philadelphia City Fund, 2024 Community Challenge Grant, AARP (American Association of Retired Persons), 2023 Digital Equity Grant y apoyo continuo del Independent Public Media Foundation, 2021 hasta el presente Digital Literacy Alliance, The Mayor's Fund for Philadelphia, 2021-2022 Rapid Response Magic Project of the Princeton Humanities Council, 2020 RISE (Recognizing Inequalities and Standing for Equality), Pace Center for Civic Engagement, 2020

item.title: Preguntas más frecuentes
item.description: ¿Quien Somos Nosotros? ¿Qué es Philly Community Wireless? Philly Community Wireless es una organización comunitaria que desarrolla redes de malla de propiedad comunitaria en el norte de Filadelfia. Somos un grupo de trabajo de organizadores, tecnólogos, académicos, maestros de escuelas públicas y personal del Ayuntamiento de Filadelfia. Buscamos abordar la brecha digital de la ciudad con tecnologías de red de malla operadas y propiedad de la comunidad. Las redes de malla permiten compartir una única conexión a Internet entre un grupo más amplio de usuarios con muy poco coste o infraestructura necesaria.

item.title: Cómo llegar aquí
item.description: PCW is located at the Norris Square Neighborhood Project at 2141 N Howard Street, adjacent to Norris Square Park. Public Transit NSNP is a quick walk from either the York-Dauphin or Berks Market-Frankford Line SEPTA stops. Driving Street parking is available around Norris Square Park; availabiliy is limited. Cycling There is an Indego stop a ~5 minute walk away at 2nd and Norris next to The Ground Coffee.

item.title: Novedades
item.description: Tech Policy, America, Disconnected: What’s Biden’s Plan for Averting Digital Disaster?, 4/30/2024 CNET, Alternative Broadband Networks: Affordable Internet for the People, One Rooftop at a Time, 10/1/2023 Kensington Voice, Norris Square organization increases community access to free internet, 7/12/2023 Technical.ly Philly, Alex Wermer-Colan and PCW awarded Community Tech Leader of the Year 2022, 12/14/2022 Al Dia, Bringing Digital Equity to North Philadelphia, 5/13/2022 Technical.ly Philly, A group of Philly technologists are working on a free, community-based mesh Wi-Fi network, 2/1/2022
